1.name: BI invocation Point
1.description: BI is performed after Fees and FX: Fees > FX > BI

2.name: BI invocation Point
2.description: BI is performed on the debit side. No balance inquiry on the credit side.

3.name: BI invocation Point
3.description: BI is performed on the debit side. No balance inquiry on the credit side.

4.name: Bypass BI
4.description: Balance Inquiry must not be invoked upon the Posting 1st step.

5.name: Inteface Selection
5.description: The relevant BI interface is selected

6.name: BI Request content
6.description: GPP is required to send Base rate and Spot rate as part of the Balance Inquiry

7.name: BI Request / Response content
7.description: Request and Response layout should be the same as for Delivery 1.

8.name: Interface Wait Behavior
8.description: Message must wait for a response in order to proceed with the flow

9.name: Interface Inactive behavior
9.description: The interface is Inactive For FILE Source:  Request is not created (except 990), stop the flow, and put the message in status BI_STOP. When the interface is active again, create the request, send it and continue with the flow. Source <> FILE: Request is not created (except 990), stop the flow, and put the message in status Rejected.

10.name: Response Handling
10.description: For FILE Source:  Stop the flow, and put the message in status BI_STOP. When the interface is active again, create the request, send it and continue with the flow. Source <> FILE: Stop the flow and put the message in status Rejected.

13.name: NSF
13.description: Re-tries will be done in a certain frequency.
